summary: The Jordan McNair Student Athlete Heat Fatality Prevention Act aims to prevent heat-related illnesses and fatalities among student athletes. It mandates that institutions of higher education and secondary schools develop and implement venue-specific emergency action plans. These plans must include symptom identification, coordination of care, and the use of equipment like automatic external defibrillators and cold water immersion. The bill also directs the Secretary of Education to promote federal grants related to heat-related illness prevention.
